result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte Lamont Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Count 2 and any other existing Sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Treatment and counseling programs, as determined by DOC Agent.

supervisions.notes:
Court set Restitution at ZERO. 
Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency.

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent to Count 1, and any other existing Sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donte Lamont Coleman

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of THREE (3) YEARS, Concurrent to Count 2 and any other existing Sentence. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is ONE (1) YEAR, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of SEVEN (7) YEARS, Concurrent to Count 1, and any other existing Sentence.
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is THREE YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE YEARS AND SIX (6) MONTHS.  

Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- Treatment and counseling programs, as determined by DOC Agent. 

Court set Restitution at ZERO. 

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court WAIVED COSTS/FEES due to Indigency. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Donte Lamont Coleman.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

JUDGE FRANKE, RESERVE BRANCH  FOR JUDGE GRAYSON, BRANCH 16
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 and COUNT 2: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Donte Lamont Coleman.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

JUDGE FRANKE, RESERVE BRANCH  FOR JUDGE GRAYSON, BRANCH 16
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense informed the Court, Defense was unable to communicate with Defendant prior to hearing. Defense requested an adjournment. For reasons stated on the record, Court passed case until 1:30 pm.

Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Donte Lamont Coleman.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. For reasons stated on the record case is adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in custody.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. No objections from the State. Court orders case adjourned for a Plea/ Sentencing date to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in court with attorney Robert J Hampton, via zoom.  Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defense counsel advises that they are still awaiting an offer from the State, and is thereforth unprepared to move forward with today's scheduled hearing. Further, State counsel infers that she will get in contact with the corresponding attorney to issue the offer. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Robert J Hampton in court, defendant Donte Lamont Coleman not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials , but is awaiting an offer from the State. Court sets next court date for a Plea Hearing date. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in court with Attorney Robert J Hampton; both appear by video.  Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Donte Lamont Coleman in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Donte Lamont Coleman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
